I've posted a number of proposed changes to the templates (and to the publisher to support template changes). Because these are likely to impact most/all IG publishers, I'm drawing your attention to them. All discussion on the #IG creation threads please.

  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/Exposing.20standards.20status.20and.20FMM.20in.20IGs
  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/Revamping.20the.20'summary'.20tab.20for.20structureDefinitions
  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/Revamping.20the.20'mustSupport'.20view
  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/Alternate.20terminology.2C.20constraint.20and.20dictionary.20views
  • https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/Proposal.20on.20improving.20IG.20template.2Fformat.20guidance
There's a Monday lunch FMG 'tooling' session to talk about Jira balloting, IG publisher tooling and whatever else is of interest https://whova.com/portal/webapp/hmwgm_202105/Agenda/1553306

I've just pushed an update to the publisher template that changes the auto-generated grouping ids injected into IGs that don't have groupings to use '-' instead of '_' (as the latter is invalid in the id element and thus makes the resources non-conformant). This shouldn't affect most users of the templates. However, if you've customized the groupings.txt file to provide custom names or descriptions or have manually asserted groupings based on the 'standard' ids, this change will break your templates and/or ids. (I did not call for comments on this change as thee was no choice but to change given that the current functionality is non-conformant. You can revert to a formal release of the base templates if necessary if you have urgent publication requirements.)
